column4: is there a way to make an actual phone call  with a modem connected?
i'm not talking about voip
a modem is not a phone. it can be used only for digital data transfers
so, what kind of modme you have?
ok, it's a umts modem. i don't think it's possible to use it for voice. maybe sms
but, why you don't want to use skype, for example? with the skypeout option you can call everywhere at low cost
i'm not 100% sure, but i don't think you can use the huwaei e169 for phone calls
the simplier thing is to move the sim card on a cell phone
as far as linux is concerned or in general?
in general
thing is - i have done it, but that was on a windows machine
with which software? maybe you can try to use it with wine
of course i could simply put the sim card back into my mobile but that'd mean that i couldnt go online on my notebook
the proprietary software it came with 'umts modem manager' or something alike
just some clarifications. the voice capability of the e169 is optional and not available anywhere. i have a e169 and i've never seen that option because here (in italy) is not available.
i have searched on the huwaei web site and there is the downloadable software to do voice calls, but it's only for win/mac
what system have you tested it on?
i use it with win and ubuntu
mainly in ubutnu
also with the green-GUI software (win)
my only suggestion is to try to use win software via wine, but i think will be hard that it will work.
haven't really gotten down with wine so far as I'm pretty new to linux but i'll defenitely also give that one a try once i find the time to, thx
